title: Ariane 6 and Vega C P160C Booster Upgrade Fully Qualified
summary:
The European Space Agency has completed the qualification review of the P160C solid-fuel booster upgrade for Ariane 6 and Vega C, confirming that it is ready for operational use. The booster is expected to be used for the first time next year aboard an Ariane 6 rocket. In March 2022, ESA announced that it would […]
The post Ariane 6 and Vega C P160C Booster Upgrade Fully Qualified appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Long March 12A reaches orbit in first reusable launch attempt, but landing fails
summary:
A first launch of the Long March 12A Chinese state-owned reusable rocket reached orbit late Monday, but attempted recovery of the first stage downrange failed. 
The post Long March 12A reaches orbit in first reusable launch attempt, but landing fails appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Sentinels in the Sky: 50 Years of GOES Satellite Observations
summary: Introduction In an era where satellite observations of Earth are commonplace, it’s easy to forget that only a few decades ago, the amount of information available about the state of Earth’s environment was limited; observations were infrequent and data were sparsely located. title: Keeping Up with PACE: Summary of the 2025 PAC3 Meeting
summary: Introduction Launched in Feb. 2024, NASA’s Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem (PACE) mission is a cornerstone of Earth system science designed to deepen our understanding of how these environmental and biological components come together to influence our climate, carbon cycle, and ecosystems. title: H3 rocket suffers upper stage anomaly, fails to correctly deploy navigation satellite
summary: The Dec. 22 launch was the fourth and final flight of an H3 rocket in 2025.

title: Tory Bruno steps down as President, CEO of ULA
summary: The announcement was made by Robert Lightfoot, the ULA Lockheed Martin Board Chair, in a statement on Monday. The board now begins a search for his permanent replacement.
